intro: Dombeya ankazobeensis subsp. befotakensis, commonly known as the Ankazobe dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, showy, cup-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant is shrub-like, with simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat.
